text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Former directors of Savannah Bank of Nigeria appear at a Lagos tribunal over mismanagement of bank funds valued at 1.12 billion naira.
- The delivery of fuel to distribution points in the commercial capital, Lagos, is expected to begin on Saturday, and should ease a petrol shortage which has lasted for several weeks.

- British High Commissioner (ambassador) Graham Burton says the international community expects Nigeria's military government to stick to its promised date of October 1, 1998 for its handover to civilian rule.
